annotation.TEXT: But, is this really "The end" for me? Find out next time!
Well, so much for the key... Let's light this place up so you guys can see what's going on here.
Alright, but I'm sure I'm not done yet! Where does this pipe go?
Hmm... There's more credits than usual for some reason... I wonder why...
Ah, Super Mario RPG castle music, and what appears to be a puzzle...
Okay, that's a gutter ball, but Bowser gets two tries!
When he sends out more Mechakoopas, just send a pair of them right back into his noggin to win the game!
Well, I guess it's time for the final battle against Bowser himself! (Yet again.)
Nuts. I'm probably making more trouble out of this than I need to.
Mechakoopas are such awesome regular enemies that they get a page all to themselves!
There we go! Wow, I guess the double-grabbing trick wasn't being as cooperative as I thought!
Oh, yeah. One more thing... I gotta check how many exits I've found. (There was a vote for it, but I was going to show this anyway.)
Hey, hey! Alright!
It's no different than usual, so jump to about 19:00 in the video if you want to skip it.
Something, something! Something something something something 3 something something. Something something, something!
As usual, conk him on the head with his own Mechakoopas.
Huh. That's interesting. These koopas are still green. In the original SMW, the green wingless ones turn yellow after the change.
If you're seeing occasional color flashes, it's not a video error. It was actually flashing like that during the game itself too, but I don't know why. It's weird...
Nope. Well, I am truly stumped on this one. If anyone knows where I can find a fifth Yoshi coin in this level, let me know!

I'm pretty sure I broke part of that puzzle, since I never did anything with the shell on the silver munchers, and the key ended up being unnecessary. And, judging by my remaining time, I'm glad I broke the puzzle somehow!
Insert obligatory silly annotation that some people will have skipped over here.

An ON/OFF switch that I'll need to toss something at, and some silver munchers with a shell on them. Oh, also, this appears to be a no flying zone, so that springboard will probably be needed to get to the upper level after I hit the switch.
Let's fling everything up here, since I'm sure I'll need them all eventually...
The underground is now a brownish gray, or something...
However, I think his 1200-pounder (or whatever it weighs) might be a little too big...

Oh, yeah. There was a vote for me to show off a weird little glitch with Mario's walking animation during the end credits. Well, if you're holding up on the control pad (or the up arrow key, or whatever's equivalent to "up" on whatever you're using) as the game transitions into the credits sequence...
The forest is now mostly pink...
Looks like a SMB1 castle, with the Super Mario All-Stars graphics. Also, the screen doesn't scroll up.
When fireballs rain from the sky between rounds, try not to get burned. (No sweat.)
...What, really? Am I seriously gonna fight an unedited Bowser? Without even so much as a bullet generator or something added in?
Okay, first I'll place the springboard over here.
Now we just need a perfect to make it truly awesome!
Almost jumped into the podoboos back there...
Peach will give you a mushroom when the next round starts (which you may or may not need).
Ah, it takes me back here, where there is now a shell available to give to the yellow koopa!
Okay, there we go. I've found 80 exits. Is that all of them, or did I miss something?

After that, it's time to go through the fire and flames again, which, depending on which game you're playing, could take over 7 minutes! However, since this isn't Guitar Hero III, it'll take only about 10 seconds.
Okay, now over here, we have a yellow shell, an ice block, and more silver munchers and green blocks, which guard an ON/OFF block that obviously needs to be hit.
And that's it! I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through Super SIG World 21!
The desert is unusually green...
Let's do all this again. Also, I bet the lag is caused by the sprite buoyancy being active.
Wait here, Yoshi. I promise I'll come back alive!
Aha! Yes, by having the shell despawn by going offscreen before it hits the lava, it will respawn normally now! Then, just lather, rinse, and repeat. Always repeat.
Mushroom? Once again, no thanks.
To be continued... Maybe?
And now, push!
Hey! Where'd you come from? Die!
Alright, and I guess I can hit this ON/OFF block with the koopa, then despawn/respawn him so that I can use him again later if needed.

1 vote to see how many laps I can get on any of the Rainbow Roads without getting hit or falling off, with my kart getting faster each lap, 1 vote for me to get used to the new channel layout (Sorry, but I still hate it.), 2 votes to find out what purple really tastes like (I'm guessing grape-flavored.), 1 vote to play Minecraft and try to build the sky tower, 1 vote for world 7 castle without special world cleared (Didn't I do that already? Or did you mean something else?), 1 vote for vote, 1 vote, 1 vote that the voter votes that the voter votes that the voter votes that the voter votes that (repeat ad infinitum), 1 vote for world 12034337 (9001*1337), and 4 votes for Bowser's castle, which is where I'm heading now!
This looks like a choice at first, but actually, I can choose all of them!
These ice blocks need to be burned, which explains the flower's presence among the other items earlier.
Oh, good. The double-grabbing is cooperating with me now.
Well, I guess it's time we head to King Koopa's castle. While I make my way there, let's look at the voting results here...
Last time, on Super SIG World 21... I finished off the Secret world!
So, could this quite possibly be the final boss?
The factory has a lot of orange in it now...
There's this hidden 1-up here, but no sign of the fifth Yoshi coin...
As a result...
HUZZAH!!!
Doesn't look like it...
Hey, Fishin' Boo! You're not so tough if I can slide-kill you!
Watch out! Bowser goes a little nuts during round three, but as long as you don't let the propeller strike you, you'll be fine.
...Mario will walk in a weird way during the credits! (You can let go of "up" at this point.)
Okay, so that's three Yoshi coins found before midpoint...
Achievement get! "Never say die!"
And here's what world 1 looks like, which doesn't seem too out of the ordinary...
Let's take a look over here first.

Okay, now this last message says... something, but I don't know what. If anyone would care to translate this message (or anything else that hasn't been translated yet in any of my Super SIG World 21 videos), that would be awesome.
Um, is the shell not respawning? ...Oh, right. The lava that's apparently below the screen must've killed the shell. Okay, let's reset the puzzle and try it again.
And once again Peach is safe... but, for how long?
If anyone knows, let me know, of course!
I said, "push"!
Huh? I saw a lava "splash" effect when that guy walked into the pit. Is there lava down there for some reason?
So, if the shell was "killed" before because it hit the "lava" below the "screen", maybe I should try "this"! (Excessive quotes "FTW"!)
During round two, Bowser likes to pretend that Mario's a bowling pin.
And next comes the enemy roll call, which I'm sure most (if not all) of us have seen more than enough times already!
After Bowser's done displaying his pathetic Bowling skills, he'll toss out two more Mechakoopas, which can promptly be returned to sender, because he forgot to put stamps on them.
The overworld colors have changed!
These might appear to be the ordinary credits, but keep watching...
Yeah, that works, so that's what I'll do!
I remember that there's a hidden 1-up here.
We now have green clouds on top of this mountain...
I wonder if we actually did meet all of these guys at some point during this hack...
Aw, just look at how happy he is! Now, to get him to hit this block...
I remember thoroughly exploring this pipe before. There's the one Yoshi coin, two 1-ups in the bricks, and a way to glitch-kill yourself in the upper-left corner.

Yep. Alright, well let's start figuring this thing out. First of all, I'm sure I'll need to eventually bring a shell over here so that the yellow koopa can climb into it, so it can hit that brick which probably contains a vine...
Here, koopa. I've got a present for you!
Wow, what a fitting end. Not only did I get 50, but it was exactly enough to get me one last bonus game!
And there's Bowser's happy and loving family, which I brutally slaughtered one by one. (I'm such a monster!)
Ah, and of course, now a few of the enemies have changed as well, just like in the original SMW.
Well, we've come all this way... Now, it's time to finish this!
Is he really that "amazing"? And why is he riding on gray used blocks instead of gray turn blocks?

5 votes to show off each of the overworld maps with the new color palettes (Done.), 1 vote for me to stay on YouTube (We'll see, but I still hate the new channel design.), 1 vote for I-1 (or perhaps it's U-1?), 1 vote for 3-1 and fly over the whole level so we can stop voting for it (Hmm...), 1 vote to do the little glitch where Mario does that weird run in the credits (Sure!), 1 vote to gain Bowser's powers so that Mario can team up with Mega Man and flame Dr. Wily (as well as torch the entire YouTube staff), 1 vote to torture the YT staff with horrible level design and build-a-bridge levels, 1 vote for Mario to solve this equation: Bowser/(Chuck+Norris/0), 1 vote for me to reboot the game when I'm done and check my exits (Of course!), 1 vote to activate BSoD (NOOOOO!!!),
...which contained a vine, as I expected. I'm sure I'll still need this key in the next room...
Okay, well first, let's free Mr. Koopa just to see what happens...
I'm flying around to make sure I don't miss anything that might be hidden up in the sky.
Something, something, some- Oh, wait, this text is in English!
And now, let's watch the credits roll...
Maybe it's beyond the goal for some reason?
Of course, anything with wings retains its original color, but those first two didn't have wings.
GAAAMMME!!!
Let's go and see what the other lands look like with the new colors!
I guess I should hit this ON/OFF block once. My cape, the key, and the shell are all capable of doing that.
Now, I'm thinking this is meant for me to somehow get a disco shell over here, but couldn't I just kick shells off the wall to the left to hit the green blocks and ON/OFF switch?
Is it in this pipe?
There's Yoshi coin number four, but where could the last one be?
Yeah, this is definitely a puzzle, and I take it that the red door is a reset door?
Agh, double-grabbing with a springboard is often annoying. I'll just move these things one at a time.
D'oh! ...Actually, will I really need that shell again? I've got an idea for that later part, and I should only need the yellow shell that's already over there.
Green koopa walking on brown blocks. Obviously a use for the P-switch...
I remember that there was once a moon up here, but I claimed that long ago.
And he missed again. Sorry, Bowser, but I guess Bowling just isn't your thing.
Yeah, I don't think there's anything else down here.
While I'm here, I'm going to check out 1-1 again. I don't believe I ever found the fifth Yoshi coin there...
Luigifan22222's translation: "Gahahaha! Finally come here! I prepared 3 rooms of the battle・action・puzzle this time! It is random where you go to. Do your best for nothing!
